bug.author: mhr
bug.summary: Unity freezes when you press play in ML-Agents Basic example scene
bug.description:
Describe the bug Unity freezes when you press play in ML-Agents Basic example scene To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
git clone --branch release_2 https://github.com/Unity-Technologies/ml-agents.git Launch Unity Hub On the Projects dialog, choose the Add option at the top of the window. Using the file dialog that opens, locate the Project folder within the ML-Agents Toolkit and click Open. In the Project window, go to the Assets/ML-Agents/Examples/Basic/Scenes folder and open the Basic scene file.
Console logs / stack traces N/A
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1429247/82613856-6595c280-9b94-11ea-96e1-bf66b240605c.png></denchmark-link>
After pressing play, Unity remains stuck like this until I kill it with Windows Task Manager^ Environment (please complete the following information):
Unity Version: Unity 2018.4.17f1 OS + version: Windows 10 ML-Agents version: ML-Agents v1.0.2-preview TensorFlow version: TensorFlow v2.2.0 Environment: Basic

comments.comment: hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mhr>@mhr</denchmark-link> - to confirm, it does not look like you are running python process to start training.
Yes, but regardless of if I set Behavior Type to "Inference Only" (which shouldn't require a Python process for training, right?), it still freezes.
I can no longer reproduce this bug. I wish I knew why.
